Dopo 15 ben spese ore di gioco, sono giunto alla conclusione di questo fantastico gioco targato mamma VALVe. Il gioco √® ottimo in tutti gli aspetti qualitativi. Ha un buon comparto audio, ogni tanto i livelli sono un po difficili in quanto gli enigmi non mancano mai, storia avvincente. L' AI √® eccellente e questo dimostra come un titolo del 2004 possa battere alcuni titoli FPS di recente usciti (non faccio nomi). Quella punta di difficolt√† √® veramente la ciliegina sulla torta di questo spettacolo videoludico. L' unica pecca √® il doppiaggio italiano che ti far√† implorare le orecchie. Per il resto, √® veramente ottimo.
P.S Se siete stanchi di un CoD - Battlefield con dei livelli troppo "pieni di corridoi" (per la loro linearit√†) ve lo consiglio al 100%
Voto 10/10

I loved the FIRST Half Life. It was a ground-breaking game with great graphics, brilliant physics and, most of all, a first-rate story (I played it whilst writing up my PhD - but not in physics). I genuinely considered this to be the greatest games ever produced. I was thrilled therefore about the second one - Half Life 2. This had amazing reviews, but sadly this did not deliver anything like the experience of the first game. It has many, many great features: the artistry, particularly of the backgrounds, is stunning, the sense of movement and scale is dramatic, the life-like physics of the world through which you travel is amazingly realistic. It is a very fast paced romp through some beautiful sets with an awful lot of shooting bad guys (the main function of an FPS I suppose). BUT it is so fast that you have no time, no breathing space, to appreciate the beauty of the your character's surroundings. Unlike Deus Ex (albeit a later game) where you are encouraged not to kill, but rather to be stealthy and explore, there is none of this in Half-Life 2. To be honest it became quite boring and repetitive shooting your way around yet another ruined street scene to then be hurried on to the next one to do exactly the same. Personally I love exploring these strange virtual worlds (I like shooting bad guys too, preferably by sniping them) but I was not given the opportunity to do so here (I understand I might be in the minority here). That is a great shame. My biggest gripe is about the STORY. Half-Life 2 has no story (regardless of what the adverts say). Here was a great opportunity to get to know some of the characters and weave an interesting story around them (as in the first game) with surprises and twists (as in the first game). Here the characters merely guide Gordon down a long and bloody road. I had hoped that the ending would reveal something. Who, for example, are the Combine? But the ending a huge anti-climax. So to conclude: I would recommend this if your only interest is a fast-paced shooter. For that it is very good. BUT if you want more subtlety and particularly story than that, then I would leave Gordon and his suit behind.
Half life 2, and its episodes are the best games I have ever played. These games are all about the story and how your character interacts with it. Masterpiece!

Truly a classic. It hasn't aged as well as it could have, but this game revolutionized games. I wish I could say more, but this is a masterpiece of gaming. While It's not my favourite game, I certainly respect it. It's still fun though. If you want to play a slice of gaming history, pick this up. It's pretty grand.

I don't feel like I have to write a review on this because there are already thousands of reviews telling to get this game and why,  but I couldn't resist giving this game the praise it deserved. I can't think of anything that I didn't enjoy in this game. The physics based combat and puzzles hasn't been matched in quality since this was released. It has an expansive and just plain awesome arsenal. The story is great, the gameplay is near-perfect, the concepts are so well thought out and executed, and it still holds up well today. The only time I ever had something against the game was with some checkpoints that can be passed by changing the difficulty and not having to deal with the checkpoints. I honestly can't say enough great things about this game. Play this to see why we need Half-LIfe 3. 10/10

I don't really get why everybody loves this game so much. It's very stressful to play, and there are some parts where you'll just want the game to end forever. I guess I'll be the only person in this planet not waiting for Half life 3, I had to stop playing the second part of the series because I just couldn' take it, it's a waste of time. Go play any other game and at least have some fun
It has been 10 years since the launch, and it still feels like a "nowadays" game. I'm sure I'll still feel this way 10 years from now ;)

Half-Life 2 es la secuela del aclamado Half-Life (Obviamente). El juego te coloca otra vez en el traje anaranjado de Gordon Freeman, un aclamado ingeniero de MIT que sobrevive a la apertura de una brecha interdimensional que permite el ingreso a nuestro planeta de alien√≠genas hostiles. Este juego se ubica varios a√±os despu√©s de Half-Life 1 y muchas cosas han cambiado, y como cosa rara... el gobierno tiene mucho que ver con la situaci√≥n de sus habitantes.

Lo califico con un 10/10, la experiencia es incre√≠ble, recomiendo comprar tambi√©n los DLC porque incluyen cap√≠tulos de la historia que sucede despu√©s de Half-Life 2

Que voy a decir de esta obra maestra. Me pase en 2013  el half life 2, y me soprendio, me agrado, y pense que estaria genial tener la continuacion de este juego. Lo mejor viene, cuando a finales de 2014 compre este juego y sus expansiones. Rejugue Half Life 2, volvio a soprenderme y encartarme.  Jugue al episodio 1 y 2. Cuando termine el episodio dos, solte dos lagrimas, y comprendi porque la gente desea half life 3 con tantas ganas. Si no lo habeis jugado, jugarlo sin dudar porque os sonprendera. Imaginad que me emociono jaja...

A parte tiene unas mecannicas de juego que JAMAS te aburriras en la partida, olvidate de los tiroteos de los shooters moderno escondido y agachado en algun sitio, asomandote para poder matar a la IA sin quwe te destrocen. Y no porque sea facil, si no porque los enemigos vienen en la cantidad jsuta para la accion y el respiro. Lo rejugue en dificil, es una pasada como sin llegar al cliche es capaz de ponerte en muy serios aprietos. ES PERFECTO, UNA OBRA MAESTRA, LO ADORARAS CUAL DIOS, Y PEDIRAS QUE SAQUEN LA CONTINUACION CUANDO JUEGUES LAS EXPANSIONES Y TE QUEDES FLIPANDO CON TODOS LOS COLORES EXISTENTES Y POR HABER. Juegalo, disfrutalo, y a esperar que VALVE nos haga el honor. Una ardua tarea, si, pero a veces hay que jugarsela. Y JUGARLO!!!

NOTA: 100 SOBRE 10 y no es hype jaja saludos si lo has leido todo...

Predict the story as you go and glitch you way through the puzzles and fight from point A to point B, in this mediocre storyline.
Seriously though, the games pretty overrated. The story line isn't anything special: You find a safe place the bad guys scare you away, you run and fight until you have to dive into hell itself. Semi common story. Very predictable. Example: The father yells over radio: "DON'T GO INTO RAVEN-"
Obviously going to Ravenholm. Her father gets captured, in my mind I'm thinking "We're going to have to go into the most guarded area to save him" Yep.

Gameplay: Shoot from point A to point B with a few companions or so. Not special, enemies are unique looking but simply programmed. 

Puzzles: Either super easy or you have to glitch your way through it.
Examples: Simple: Put a few barrels into the water under a bridge to make the bridge traversable by vehicle. Having to glitch: In the airboat you need to put crap in a box to make the board raise so you can ramp over a wall. Simple, except there wasn't enough crap to put in the box. I had to throw a grenade in, it exploded and glitched the system to thing the blast pressure was still inacting on the box, and I was able to ramp.

Half-Life 2 traz tudo o que o primeiro game trouxe e revoluciona ainda mais.A saga de Gordon Freeman continua 20 anos depois de onde ela parou no √∫ltimo jogo,j√° que G-Man deixou Gordon em coma durante esse tempo.E que tempo.O mundo,desde que Freeman dorme pela √∫ltima vez,mudou muito.

O Incidente de Black Mesa proporcionado por Freeman no primeiro jogo permitiu que uma ra√ßa alien√≠gena entrasse na Terra e dominasse tudo,criando at√© um campo de supress√£o para a ra√ßa humana n√£o se reproduzir.Wallace Breen,antigo chefe da Black Mesa,agora √© o ‚ÄúDono da Terra‚Äù,posto dado √° ele pelos Combine,a ra√ßa alien√≠gena que invadiu o planeta.

Outro ponto √≥timo √© a Hist√≥ria do jogo.Um enfoque em personagens foi feito,j√° que a √∫nica intera√ß√£o humana que v√≠amos no primeiro jogo eram cientistas abrindo portas (E depois,matar eles sem motivo).Agora n√≥s temos personagens que interagem e constroem uma hist√≥ria.S√£o Eli Vance,Alyx Vance,Isaac Kleiner,Barney Calhoun (Que √© protagonista de um jogo da s√©rie Half Life ‚Äì A expans√£o Blue Shift),Wallace Breen e outros.Eles tornam a hist√≥ria mais viva e muito melhor ‚Äì E sim,parece existir um interesse rom√¢ntico de Gordon em Alyx.

-Pontos Positivos :)
-Adi√ß√£o de personagens bem-constru√≠dos.
-Hist√≥ria bem-trabalhada e com final bem misterioso.
-Adi√ß√£o de ve√≠culos!
-Possibilidade de ter uma parceira,Alyx Vance,te ajudando em alguns momentos do jogo.
-F√≠sica muito boa.
-Possibilidade de recrutar revolucion√°rios em determinado per√≠odo do game.
-Batalhas divertidas e que exigem racioc√≠nio.
-Gr√°fico maravilhoso.
-A Intelig√™ncia Artificial continua boa.

-Pontos negativos :(
-Parece mais curto que o anterior,mas nem √© muito.
-Falta de √°reas estilo do primeiro jogo com salas com muitos monstros.
-Tamb√©m parece mais f√°cil.
-Pela vig√©sima vez,Valve,onde est√° Half-Life 3?
